result.execSummary:
The defendant James J Buck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Probation may be served in Waupaca County.

Count 1 & 2
Count 1 & 2

Defendant James J Buck in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:49 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.
State has filed an amended information.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2. Count 3 would be dismissed and read in

Atty Barkley concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 45 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber for employment and any counseling if having to serve this
2 days sentence credit if revoked
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Sign all necessary releases so agent can monitor treatment and medications being prescribed
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Pay fine of $50 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Pay attorney fees

Count 2:
Jail sentence of 150 Days, concurrent to Count 1, Imposed and Stayed
First 75 must be in, second half may be on gps electronic monitor if approved by jail and risk assessment tool
Huber for employment and counseling 
2 days sentence credit if revoked
Probation for a period of 12 Months concurrent to Ct 1
Conditions:
Comply  with conditions as stated in Count 1.
Pay fine of $50 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge  
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge


Probation may be served in Waupaca County
Any bond posted shall be applied to fine and costs

/s/ TTF 02/29/16 - THE COURT FINDS AND ORDERS:  This petition is granted because the Court finds this person is currently indigent.  An attorney shall be appointed at county expense as set forth below.  The person shall be required to reimburse the county for such respresentation as follows:  repayment at the rate of $200 per month until the total sum is paid.  The first paymnent shall be made on 03/10/16.  Payments shall be made to the Clerk of Court - subsequent payments by the first of each month there after.
